text: Activation of E2F - mediated transcription by human T-cell leukemia virus type I <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein in a <extra_id_0> p16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> INK4A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) - negative T-cell line .
The human T-cell leukemia virus type I ( HTLV-I ) is a causative agent of adult T-cell leukemia .

Although the exact mechanism by which HTLV-I contributes to leukemogenesis is still unclear , the <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein is thought to play a major role in this process .
This 40-kDa polypeptide is able to interact with the tumor suppressor <extra_id_0> p16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> INK4A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

Consequently , <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can activate the signaling pathway that lead to the release of E2F that in turn induces expression of factors required for cell cycle progression .

In this paper , we demonstrate that <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can also activate E2F - mediated transcription independently of <extra_id_0> p16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> INK4A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

Indeed , when <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is coexpressed with the <extra_id_0> E2F-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factor in CEM T-cells , which lack expression of <extra_id_0> p16 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> INK4A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , it strongly potentiates the E2F - dependent activation of a reporter construct driven by a promoter containing E2F binding sites .
This stimulation is abrogated by mutations affecting the E2F - binding sites .
In addition , <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also stimulates the transcription of the <extra_id_0> E2F-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene itself .

text: Using <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants that fail to activate either ATF - or NF-kappaB - dependent promoters and different 5 ' truncation mutants of the <extra_id_0> E2F-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , we show that the <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent transcriptional control of the <extra_id_0> E2F1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene involves , at least in part , the ATF binding site located in the <extra_id_0> E2F-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
